The East Java Regional Police stated that two bombers detonated their devices at the checkpoint of the police headquarters.{{cite news|title=Bom di Polrestabes Surabaya Meledak di Pos Pemeriksaan|last=Rinanda |first= Hilda M.|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4019190/bom-di-polrestabes-surabaya-meledak-di-pos-pemeriksaan|work=Detik.com|date=14 May 2018|language=id|accessdate=14 May 2018}} Police said ten people (four policemen and six civilians) were wounded. Four suicide bombers were killed.{{cite web|title=4 Pengebom Polrestabes Surabaya Tewas|last=Rinanda |first= Hilda M.|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4019394/4-pengebom-polrestabes-surabaya-tewas|work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|date=14 May 2018|language=id}} The attack, which occurred at the entrance of the police HQ, was captured on camera. The video showed a car entering the checkpoint when suddenly four people, who were riding two motorcycles, entered the area. The video revealed that the motorcycles were halted by a group of policemen. The perpetrators then suddenly detonated their explosive devices. In the video, one of the perpetrators was a woman.{{cite web|title=Pelaku Bom di Mapolrestabes Surabaya Diduga Satu Keluarga|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4019406/pelaku-bom-di-mapolrestabes-surabaya-diduga-satu-keluarga|work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|date=14 May 2018|language=id|first=Mei A.|last=Rahmat}} In the aftermath of the attack, a child aged eight, whom the police suspect was the perpetrators' daughter, was brought to the police station to attack, was found walking and screaming amidst the bodies. Police said she was in critical condition.{{cite web|title=Polisi Bopong Bocah Perempuan dari TKP Bom Polrestabes Surabaya|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4019198/polisi-bopong-bocah-perempuan-dari-tkp-bom-polrestabes-surabaya|work=Detik.com|last1=Ibrahim|first1=Gibran M.|last2=Saputra|first2=Andi|accessdate=14 May 2018|date=14 May 2018|language=id}} Police immediately closed nearby roads. Businesses and shops were ordered to be close in the vicinity of the area. All kinds of service in the police HQ were temporarily terminated in response to the attack.{{cite web|title=Layanan SIM Polrestabes Surabaya Ditutup Sementara |last=Effendi |first=Zaenal|url=https://news.detik.com/berita-jawa-timur/d-4019571/layanan-sim-polrestabes-surabaya-ditutup-sementara |work=Detik.com |accessdate=14 May 2018|date=14 May 2018|language=id}} ==Casualties== As of 1 June 2018, 15 civilians and 13 suicide bombers were killed. Among them are children aged 11 and 8, who were identified as Evan and Nathan, and two security officers who were trying to stop the perpetrators from entering the church. Aloysius Bayu Rendra Wardhana, a security volunteer{{cite news|last=Budianto|first=Enggran E.|title=Bayu Penghadang Bomber Bukan Satpam, Polisi Minta Maaf|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4021794/bayu-penghadang-bomber-bukan-satpam-polisi-minta-maaf|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=Detik.com|date=15 May 2018|language=id}} and Yesaya Bayang, a security officer, were regarded as heroes by locals for successfully stopping the perpetrators from entering SMTB and GKI Diponegoro respectively.{{cite news |title=Heroik, Bayu Hadang Pengebom Sebelum Bom Gereja Meledak |last=Effendi |first=Zaenal |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018478/heroik-bayu-hadang-pengebom-sebelum-bom-gereja-meledak|work=Detik.com |date=13 May 2018|accessdate=13 May 2018|language=id}} A security officer died on 19 May.https://regional.kompas.com/read/2018/05/19/16595781/satpam-gereja-pantekosta-surabaya-meninggal-dunia-setelah-sepekan-kritis One victim succumbed to his injuries 18 days after the bombings.{{Cite news|url=https://m.detik.com/news/jawatimur/4049232/18-hari-dirawat-satu-korban-bom-gereja-di-surabaya-meninggal|title=18 Hari Dirawat, Satu Korban Bom Gereja di Surabaya Meninggal|last=Utomo|first=Deni Prastyo|work=detiknews|access-date=24 June 2018}} Injured victims of the blasts were treated in 8 hospitals.{{cite news|title=Minggu Malam, 43 Korban Luka Bom Surabaya Masih Dirawat di 8 RS|url=https://regional.kompas.com/read/2018/05/13/20472921/minggu-malam-43-korban-luka-bom-surabaya-masih-dirawat-di-8-rs|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Kompas|date=13 May 2018|language=id|first=Achmad|last=Faizal}} The local branch of the [[Indonesian Red Cross]] reported an upsurge in blood donations, with 600 people donating blood that day compared to the routine target of 400.{{cite news|title=Ratusan Warga Surabaya Donor Darah Bantu Korban Bom Gereja|url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20180513203511-20-297854/ratusan-warga-surabaya-donor-darah-bantu-korban-bom-gereja|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=CNN Indonesia|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} ==Investigation== Hours after the attacks, the Chief of the Indonesian National Police [[Tito Karnavian]], stated in a news conference that [[Jamaah Ansharut Daulah]], a local branch of the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|Islamic State]], was the group who was responsible for perpetrating the attacks. The group was responsible for the previous [[2016 Samarinda church bombing|church bombing in Samarinda]] in 2016 and was also blamed for a series of attacks against the Indonesian police in 2016 and 2017.{{cite news|title=Kapolri: Satu Keluarga Pengebom Gereja Surabaya Jaringan JAD|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018572/kapolri-satu-keluarga-pengebom-gereja-surabaya-jaringan-jad|last=Prasetia|first=Andhika|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=13 May 2018}} He later added that based on eyewitness accounts, the attackers were probably from the same family. Multiple people claimed that prior to the attack, the woman and her two childrens, aged 12 and 9, in the second attack were dropped off from an SUV. According to him, the man who drove the SUV was her husband. He then drove the SUV and rammed it into the GPPS, where the third attack occurred. Their sons were the ones who drove the motorcycle in the first attack.{{cite news|title=Kapolri: Pengebom Gereja Surabaya Diduga Satu Keluarga|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018529/kapolri-pengebom-gereja-surabaya-diduga-satu-keluarga|last=Prasetia|first=Andhika|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=13 May 2018|language=id}} According to official report, the perpetrators had just got back from "education" in Syria. The family, according to Tito, was among the 500 people who were monitored by the government.{{cite news|title=Keluarga Pengebom Gereja Surabaya Baru Pulang 'Sekolah' dari Suriah|last=Rinanda |first= Hilda M.|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018581/keluarga-pengebom-gereja-surabaya-baru-pulang-sekolah-dari-suriah|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=13 May 2018|language=id}} Australian counter-terrorism expert Professor Greg Barton of [[Deakin University]] stated that the perpetrators are 'self-contained', deliberately cut off every communication with the other members via digital communications to avoid detection from the police. According to him, this was similar to the [[November 2015 Paris attacks]]. He later added that the weak anti-terror law in Indonesia caused terrorists in Indonesia to travel to Iraq and Syria with ease, and that those who might have been involved with the Islamic State wouldn't be punished by the authorities. There was also considerable concern on the use of children in terror attacks.{{cite web|first1=Devianti|last1=Faridz|first2=Euan|last2=McKirdy|first3=Eliza|last3=Mackintosh|title=Three families were behind the ISIS-inspired bombings in Indonesia's Surabaya, police said|url=http://www.abc17news.com/news/national-world/surabaya-hit-with-another-attack-in-wake-of-church-bombings/741525169 |work=[[KMIZ]]|date=14 May 2018|accessdate=15 May 2018}} ===Motive=== Indonesian National Police revealed that the attacks were directly ordered by [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|ISIL]] as revenge for the imprisonment of Aman Abdurrahman, the leader of JAD and JAT in Indonesia.{{cite web|title=Kapolri Sebut Bom Surabaya Aksi Balasan karena Pimpinan JAD Ditangkap|url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2018/05/14/12580671/kapolri-sebut-bom-surabaya-aksi-balasan-karena-pimpinan-jad-ditangkap|date=14 May 2018|language=id|last=Faizal |first=Achmad|work=Kompas.com|accessdate=14 May 2018}} Abdurrahman should have been released from jail on August 2017, but he was arrested again by the police as he was alleged to have supplied weapons and funds for the terrorists who executed the [[2016 Jakarta attacks]]. He was in prison at the time for his role in conducting training for terrorists in Aceh. In response to his imprisonment, the leadership in JAD was handed to Zainal Anshori. However, Anshori was immediately arrested after authorities stated that he was involved in weapon smuggling in Southern Philippines. This reportedly infuriated the members of the JAD and JAT. In response, the members of the JAD and the JAT started to attack civilians and police officers. The first major attack was the [[2018 Mako Brimob standoff]], days before the Surabaya bombings.{{cite web|title=Kapolri: Dita Pengebom Gereja Surabaya Ketua JAD di Surabaya|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018759/kapolri-dita-pengebom-gereja-surabaya-ketua-jad-di-surabaya|work=Detik.com|language=id|accessdate=14 May 2018|last=Rinanda |first= Hilda M. |date=13 May 2018}} ===Raids and arrests=== Hours after the incident in Wonocolo, Indonesian police raided a house in Masanganwetan, Sukodono, Sidoarjo. During the raid, a shootout erupted between a suspected terrorist and the police.{{cite web|title=Densus 88 Baku Tembak Dengan Kelompok Teroris di Sidoarjo |language=id |url=https://nasional.tempo.co/read/1088635/densus-88-baku-tembak-dengan-kelompok-teroris-di-sidoarjo|work=Tempo.co|accessdate=14 May 2018 |editor-last=Susanto|editor-first=Elik|date=14 May 2018}} The terrorist was later shot and killed. He was identified as Budi Satrio. Two men and two women were found on the site and were arrested. The police stated that pipe bombs were found on the site. Several ambulances were dispatched to the area.{{cite web|title=Densus 88 Gerebek Dua Lokasi di Sidoarjo, Beberapa Terduga Teroris Ditangkap|url=https://news.okezone.com/read/2018/05/14/519/1897993/densus-88-gerebek-dua-lokasi-di-sidoarjo-beberapa-terduga-teroris-ditangkap|work=Okezone.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|date=14 May 2018|language=id}}{{cite web|title=Aparat Gerebek Terduga Teroris Di Sukodono Sidoarjo|url=http://www.surabayapagi.com/read/175176/2018/05/14/aparat-gerebek-terduga-teroris-di-sukodono-sidoarjo.html|work=Surabayapagi.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|date=14 May 2018|language=id}} Three other suspects were arrested in Surabaya, with the police officials claiming that the suspects had planned for further attacks although the locations were not disclosed. In total, the raids in Sidoarjo and Surabaya killed 2 suspects and arrested 7.{{cite news|last1=Sarwanto|first1=Abi|title=Densus 88 Amankan Tujuh Terduga Teroris di Jatim, Dua Tewas|url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20180514145431-12-298078/densus-88-amankan-tujuh-terduga-teroris-di-jatim-dua-tewas|accessdate=14 May 2018|work=CNN Indonesia|date=14 May 2018|language=id}} Widespread raids and arrests were done by [[Detachment 88]] in [[Bekasi]],{{cite news|title=Densus 88 kembali tangkap terduga teroris di Bekasi |url=https://www.antaranews.com/berita/709361/densus-88-kembali-tangkap-terduga-teroris-di-bekasi|accessdate=14 May 2018|work=AntaraNews.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id|first=Mayolus F.|last=Dwiyanto}} [[Sukabumi]],{{cite news|title=Densus 88 amankan dua orang di Sukabumi |url=https://www.antaranews.com/berita/709353/densus-88-amankan-dua-orang-di-sukabumi|accessdate=14 May 2018|work=AntaraNews.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id|first=Aditia A.|last=Rohman}} [[Palembang]],{{cite news|last1=Hadinata|first1=Welly|title=BREAKING NEWS: Dua Terduga Teroris Diamankan di Kawasan KM 5 Palembang|url=http://palembang.tribunnews.com/2018/05/14/breaking-news-dua-terduga-teroris-diamankan-di-kawasan-km-5-palembang|accessdate=16 May 2018|work=Sriwijaya Post|date=14 May 2018|language=id-ID}} [[Tangerang]]{{cite news|last1=Puspita|first1=Sherly|title=Densus 88 Tangkap 3 Terduga Teroris di Tangerang|url=https://megapolitan.kompas.com/read/2018/05/16/13504061/densus-88-tangkap-3-terduga-teroris-di-tangerang|accessdate=16 May 2018|work=KOMPAS|date=16 May 2018|language=id}} and [[Cianjur]]. In the Cianjur raid, four suspected terrorists were killed after a shootout in a bus terminal. They had carried explosive, bomb-tipped arrows and allegedly planned to attack the Brimob headquarters.{{cite news|title=Terduga teroris Cianjur bawa panah yang ujungnya bom|url=https://www.antaranews.com/berita/709293/terduga-teroris-cianjur-bawa-panah-yang-ujungnya-bom|accessdate=14 May 2018|work=AntaraNews.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id|first=Aubrey K.|last=Fanani}} According to the police, as many as eight raids were conducted throughout Indonesia. They added that 2 terrorists were killed due to resisting arrest.{{cite web|title=Polri Tindak 7 Pelaku Teror Sidoarjo-Surabaya, 2 Tewas |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4019732/polri-tindak-7-pelaku-teror-sidoarjo-surabaya-2-tewas|work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018 |date=14 May 2018|language=id|first=Hilda M.|last=Rinanda}} On 15 May, 2 days after the initial bombings, a shootout occurred between [[Detachment 88]] personnel and a group suspected to be affiliated with the bombers in the Manukan Kulon ''kelurahan'' (administrative village) in Surabaya.{{cite news|last=Sarwanto|first=Abi|title=Densus Baku Tembak dengan Kelompok Teror di Surabaya|url=https://cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20180515175700-12-298420/densus-baku-tembak-dengan-kelompok-teror-di-surabaya|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=CNN Indonesia|date=15 May 2018|language=id}} A man around the age of 40 who was part of the group was killed.{{cite news|last=Sarwanto|first=Abi|title=Baku Tembak Polisi-Teroris, Satu Jenazah Tiba di RS|url=https://cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20180515182646-20-298432/baku-tembak-polisi-teroris-satu-jenazah-tiba-di-rs|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=CNN Indonesia|date=15 May 2018|language=id}} In a raid in Tanjung Balai Asahan, North Sumatra, at least 2 people were shot by the police and were later arrested.{{citeweb|title=Dua Terduga Teroris di Sumut Ditembak|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4022418/dua-terduga-teroris-di-sumut-ditembak|publisher=''Detik.com''|accessdate=16 May 2018}} Three residents of Malang were also arrested.{{citeweb|title=Tiga Warga Malang Diamankan Densus 88, Terkait Jaringan JAD?|url=https://news.detik.com/berita-jawa-timur/d-4022644/tiga-warga-malang-diamankan-densus-88-terkait-jaringan-jad |publisher=''Detik.com''|accessdate=16 May 2018}} On 16 May, another shootout occurred at a house in Kuciran Indah, Tangerang. Another house was raided by the police. 3 people were arrested. The Indonesian police revealed that they were members of the Jakarta JAD.{{citeweb|title=3 Terduga Teroris Tangerang Kelompok JAD Jakarta|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4023500/3-terduga-teroris-tangerang-kelompok-jad-jakarta|publisher=''Detik.com''|accessdate=17 May 2018}} Several people were arrested in East Java, Central Java, West Java and Banten. Another 2 people were arrested in Sidoarjo.{{citeweb|title=Lagi, Densus Tangkap Terduga Teroris di Sidoarjo|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4024339/lagi-densus-tangkap-terduga-teroris-di-sidoarjo|publisher=''Detik.com''|accessdate=17 May 2018}} An anti-terror operation was also carried out in Probolinggo in a small "executive" musalla. Airguns, documents and electronics were recovered from the area. Three people were arrested in the raid. {{citeweb|title=Densus Juga Sita Elektronik Rakitan Saat Gerebek Teroris Probolinggo|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4024290/densus-juga-sita-elektronik-rakitan-saat-gerebek-teroris-probolinggo|publisher=''Detik.com''|accessdate=17 May 2018}} The police announced that they had arrested 33 suspected terrorists across Indonesia. They added that ISIL flags, documents and multiple bombs were also recovered from the nationwide anti-terror operations.{{citeweb|title=Total 33 Terduga Teroris Ditangkap Polisi di Sejumlah Tempat|url=https://www.msn.com/id-id/berita/nasional/total-33-terduga-teroris-ditangkap-polisi-di-sejumlah-tempat/ar-AAxmau2|publisher=MSN|accessdate=17 May 2018}} On the same day, the police defused 31 pipe bombs.{{citeweb|title=Ini Bom Teroris Surabaya dan Sidoarjo yang Dimusnahkan Polisi|url=https://news.detik.com/berita-jawa-timur/d-4024137/ini-bom-teroris-surabaya-dan-sidoarjo-yang-dimusnahkan-polisi?_ga=2.158905338.177957252.1526446395-2122087196.1514282302|publisher=Detik.com|accessdate=17 May 2018}} The police stated that the total bombs that were recovered are as many as one truck.{{citeweb|title=Ngeri! Total Bom dari Rumah Teroris Surabaya dan Sidoarjo 1 Truk|url=https://news.detik.com/jawatimur/4023920/ngeri-total-bom-dari-rumah-teroris-surabaya-dan-sidoarjo-1-truk|publisher=''Detik.com''|accessdate=17 May 2018}} On 1 June, the Indonesian police announced that they had arrested 37 suspects after a series of anti-terror operations across Indonesia. 4 people, who were accused of terrorism, were killed during shootouts.{{citeweb|title=Surabaya terror attacks: 37 suspects arrested, 4 killed, says Indonesia's top cop|url=https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/surabaya-terror-attacks-37-suspects-arrested-4-killed-says-indonesias-top-cop|publisher=''The Straits Times''|date=1 June 2018|accessdate=9 July 2018}} By mid-July, 197 suspected terrorists had been apprehended, of which 20 were killed during the raids.{{cite news |title=Pasca Bom Surabaya, Polri Tangkap 197 Terduga Teroris, 20 di Antaranya Tewas|url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2018/07/16/10514591/pasca-bom-surabaya-polri-tangkap-197-terduga-teroris-20-di-antaranya-tewas |accessdate=16 July 2018 |work=KOMPAS |date=16 July 2018 |language=id}} ===Security=== In Surabaya, the East Java Regional Police asked for cancellation of all Sunday services for the day in response to the attacks.{{cite news|title=Pasca Bom Meledak di Surabaya, Seluruh Kegiatan Gereja Dihentikan|url=https://news.detik.com/berita-jawa-timur/d-4018164/pasca-bom-meledak-di-surabaya-seluruh-kegiatan-gereja-dihentikan|last=Utomo |first=Deni P.|work=Detik.com|language=id|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=13 May 2018}} The [[Jakarta Metropolitan Police]] raised Jakarta's terror alert level to the highest level (Level 1), effective from 13 May 2018 at 08:00 local time.{{cite news|last=Puspita|first=Sherly|title=Pascaledakan Bom di Surabaya, Kapolda Metro Tetapkan Jakarta dan Sekitarnya Siaga 1|url=https://megapolitan.kompas.com/read/2018/05/13/11442531/pascaledakan-bom-di-surabaya-kapolda-metro-tetapkan-jakarta-dan|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Kompas|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} The province of Central Java, Yogyakarta and Riau Islands later followed Jakarta's action to raise the terror threat level in their provinces,{{cite web|title=Jakarta, East Java, Riau Islands on highest alert after Surabaya bombings|first1=Gemma H.|last1=Cahya|first2=Ni Komang|last2=Erviani|author3=Fadli|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2018/05/13/jakarta-east-java-riau-islands-on-highest-alert-after-surabaya-bombings.html|work=The Jakarta Post|accessdate=14 May 2018}} and the status was set to a national level by the [[Indonesian National Police]]. The police spokesman noted that the status was an internal one for police officers and that civilians should go about normally.{{cite news|title=Polri Tetapkan Indonesia Siaga Satu|url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20180514141911-12-298069/polri-tetapkan-indonesia-siaga-satu|accessdate=14 May 2018|work=CNN Indonesia|date=14 May 2018|language=id}} Police official stated that Jakarta would remain on that level for an indefinite time. As many as 8,000 police personnel were dispatched in [[Makassar]], [[South Sulawesi]] to guard churches and vital objects across the city. Police in Malang stated that roughly as many as 250 personnel would be dispatched across Malang to protect the city's churches.{{cite news|title=Pasca Bom Surabaya, Pengamanan Gereja di Malang Diperketat |author=Aminudin |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018374/pasca-bom-surabaya-pengamanan-gereja-di-malang-diperketat|work=Detik.com|language=id|accessdate=13 May 2018|date=13 May 2018}} The Jakarta Metropolitan Police later lowered the status on 15 May 2018.{{cite news|title=Polda Metro Jaya Turunkan Status Siaga Satu |date=15 May 2018|language=id|work=CNN Indonesia |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20180515141744-12-298350/polda-metro-jaya-turunkan-status-siaga-satu|accessdate=15 May 2018}} The West Java Regional Police stated that security throughout West Java is tightened in response to the attacks and multiple police personnel would be dispatched across West Java.{{cite news|title=Teror Bom di Surabaya, Polda Jabar Tingkatkan Pengamanan|url=https://news.detik.com/berita-jawa-barat/d-4018337/teror-bom-di-surabaya-polda-jabar-tingkatkan-pengamanan|last=Solehudin |first=Mochamad |work=Detik.com|language=id|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=13 May 2018}} The security at [[Ngurah Rai International Airport]] in [[Denpasar]], [[Bali]] would be tightened in response to the attacks.{{cite news|title=Pasca Bom Surabaya, Pengamanan Bandara Ngurah Rai Diperketat|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018335/pasca-bom-surabaya-pengamanan-bandara-ngurah-rai-diperketat|last=Astika |first=Nandhang R.|work=Detik.com|language=id|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=13 May 2018}} A prompt inspection was conducted at [[Soekarno-Hatta International Airport]] in [[Tangerang]].{{cite news|title=Usai Teror Bom Surabaya, Menhub Cek Bandara Soetta|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018504/usai-teror-bom-surabaya-menhub-cek-bandara-soetta|work=Detik.com|accessdate=13 May 2018|date=13 May 2018|language=id|last=Ikhsanuddin|first=Arief}} Police officers were deployed to the crime scenes to investigate and safeguard the areas, including members of [[Mobile Brigade Corps]] (Brimob) and the bomb squad. The police said that evacuation of victims was their primary focus.{{cite news|title=Polisi Evakuasi Korban Ledakan Bom Gereja di Surabaya|url=http://www.republika.co.id/berita/nasional/hukum/18/05/13/p8n8ye430-polisi-evakuasi-korban-ledakan-bom-gereja-di-surabaya|first=Arif S.|last=Nugroho|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Republika.co.id|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} The bombings also prompted the Surabaya administration to cancel the Rujak Uleg Festival on Kembang Jepun Street, slated to be opened by Mayor of Surabaya [[Tri Rismaharini]] at noon, to commemorate the city’s 725th anniversary.{{cite news|title=Alasan Keamanan, Pemkot Surabaya Batalkan Festival Rujak Uleg |date=13 May 2018|language=id|last=Faizal |first=Achmad|url=https://regional.kompas.com/read/2018/05/13/13045491/alasan-keamanan-pemkot-surabaya-batalkan-festival-rujak-uleg|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Kompas.com}} In response to the attacks on 13 May, schools across Surabaya were closed on 14 May. Mayor of Surabaya Tri Rismaharini later added that the period would be extended due to security concern.{{cite web|title=Alasan Keamanan, Risma Perpanjang Masa Libur Sekolah di Surabaya|url=https://news.detik.com/berita-jawa-timur/d-4020243/alasan-keamanan-risma-perpanjang-masa-libur-sekolah-di-surabaya|date=14 May 2018|work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|language=id|last=Effendi |first=Zaenal}} In response to the bombings, the Chief of the Indonesian National Police Tito Karnavian stated that this is the time for the revision of the anti-terror bill, later urged the members of the Indonesian House of Representatives to revise the anti-terrorism bill, which was viewed as a weak bill by many. According to Tito, terrorists easily evaded arrests due to the bill. Police couldn't arrest and prevent terror attacks due to the absence of a strong terror bill. The police technically couldn't arrest the terror suspects if the terror attack had not been executed.{{cite web|title=Kapolri: Revisi UU Antiterorisme Bisa Buat JAD Organisasi Teroris|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4018653/kapolri-revisi-uu-antiterorisme-bisa-buat-jad-organisasi-teroris|work=Detik.com|last=Prasetia|first=Andhika|language=id|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018}} Many experts supported and urged the governments to revise the anti-terror bill. Political expert from the Indonesian Political Analysis Institute Maksimus Ramses urged the government to form a special committee for the revision. If the anti-terror bill was revised by the government, the group who was responsible behind the attack Jamaah Ansharut Daulah (JAD) could be listed by the government as a terror group and terror attacks could be quickly prevented.{{cite web|title=DPR Didesak Segera Percepat Revisi UU Anti Terorisme|url=http://mediaindonesia.com/read/detail/160594-dpr-didesak-segera-percepat-revisi-uu-anti-terorisme |work=MediaIndonesia.com |language=id|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018}} The terror threat throughout Indonesia was raised to its highest level. In response to the emergency, [[Ministry of Transportation (Indonesia)|Indonesian Minister of Transportation]] [[Budi Karya Sumadi]] ordered the security in every airports and seaports in Indonesia to be heightened to the maximum.{{cite web|title=Tragedi Bom Surabaya, Menhub Perketat Pengamanan di Simpul Transportasi Strategis |date=13 May 2018|last=Tristiawati|first=Pramita |url=https://www.liputan6.com/bisnis/read/3523959/tragedi-bom-surabaya-menhub-perketat-pengamanan-di-simpul-transportasi-strategis |work=Liputan6.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|language=id}} ==Perpetrators== The Indonesian National Police alongside with the East Java Regional Police confirmed that three families were responsible for the bombings in Surabaya and Sidoarjo.{{cite web|title=Polisi: Tiga Keluarga di Balik Teror Bom di Surabaya-Sidoarjo|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4019589/polisi-tiga-keluarga-di-balik-teror-bom-di-surabaya-sidoarjo|work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|date=14 May 2018|language=id|first=Hilda M.|last=Rinanda}} [[Amaq News Agency]] claimed [[Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant]] (ISIL) responsibility for the attacks, the bomb that was used during the attacks was [[Acetone peroxide|TATP]] or 'Mother of Satan', a type that ISIL had used in [[Iraq]] and [[Syria]].{{cite news|title=Islamic State claims responsibility for Indonesian church attacks|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-indonesia-bomb-churches/family-of-is-inspired-suicide-bombers-attack-indonesian-churches-at-least-13-dead-idUSKCN1IE01U|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Reuters|date=13 May 2018|last=Kapoor|first=Kanupriya}}{{cite news|title='Mother of Satan' explosives used in Surabaya church bombings: Police|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2018/05/14/mother-of-satan-explosives-used-in-surabaya-church-bombings-police.html|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Reuters|date=16 May 2018|last=Putra|first=Neda}} === Dita Supriyanto family === The church bombers were identified by the police as a family of six, headed by Dita Supriyanto, the father and Puji Kuswati, the mother. They also involved their children, Yusuf Fadil (aged 18), Firman Halim (aged 16), Fadilah Sari (aged 12) and Pamela Rizkita (aged 9). Puji became the first female suicide bomber in Indonesia.{{cite web|url=https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/indonesias-first-female-suicide-bomber-a-mum-of-4-0 |last=Soeriaatmadja |first=Wahyudi |title=Indonesia's first female suicide bomber a mum of 4|work=The Straits Times |date=14 May 2018 |accessdate=14 May 2018}} Dita was responsible for the third attack where he drove his SUV with highly explosive material to the GPPS. According to the police, the explosion in the third attack was the most powerful. The police stated that the woman was a resident of [[Banyuwangi]], a city located approximately {{convert|306|km}} southeast of Surabaya.{{cite news |title=Pakai Bom Pinggang dan Bom Pangku, Pelaku Berasal dari Banyuwangi|last= Rinanda |first= Hilda M. |date=13 May 2018 |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018708/wanita-pengebom-gereja-gki-surabaya-berasal-dari-banyuwangi|work= Detik.com |accessdate=13 May 2018|language=id}} The Indonesian National Police announced that 3 types of bombs were used in the church attacks. According to them, the bomb in the third attack was the most explosive type and the most destructive, powerful enough to destroy dozens of vehicles and set fire to the front portion of the church.{{cite web|date=13 May 2018|title=Jenis Bom di 3 Gereja Surabaya: Bom Mobil Hingga Ikat Pinggang|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018560/jenis-bom-di-3-gereja-surabaya-bom-mobil-hingga-ikat-pinggang|last=Prasetia|first=Andhika|work=Detik.com|language=id|accessdate=14 May 2018}} The first attack was carried out using motorcycle bomb, the second was using belt bombs, and the third was using a car bomb. The bombs in the second attack were strapped on the three perpetrators, Puji and her 12 and 9 year old daughters. This was evidenced by the examination of their bodies where a specific area (their stomachs area) were torn apart due to the force of the blast. Investigators are still trying to determine the type of bombs that were used in the first attack.{{cite web|title=Bom Surabaya, Kapolri Ungkap Tiga Jenis Bom yang Dipakai|url=https://nasional.tempo.co/read/1088474/bom-surabaya-kapolri-ungkap-tiga-jenis-bom-yang-dipakai|date=13 May 2018|first=Hussein|last=Abri|work=Tempo.co|language=id|accessdate=14 May 2018}} On the night of 13 May, a house in Wonorejo Asri in Rungkut, Surabaya was stormed by the police. They discovered 3 highly explosive bombs from the house, which were later defused by bomb disposal unit.{{cite web|title=Polisi Temukan 3 Bom High Explosive di Rumah Pengebom Gereja Surabaya|date=13 May 2018|language=id|last=Effendi |first=Zaenal|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018730/polisi-temukan-3-bom-high-explosive-di-rumah-pengebom-gereja-surabaya |work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018}} Arrows and a bow were discovered on the back of the house. The police also recovered several books and documents from the house for investigation purposes.{{cite web|title=Geledah Rumah Pengebom Gereja Surabaya, Polisi Temukan Panah |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018731/geledah-rumah-pengebom-gereja-surabaya-polisi-temukan-panah|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|last=Effendi |first=Zaenal|language=id|accessdate=14 May 2018}} Indonesian National Police later revealed that Dita Supriyanto was the leader of the Surabaya branch of [[Jamaah Ansharut Daulah]] (JAD, [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|State's]] [[Ansar (Islam)|Ansar]] Pilgrims). === Anton Febryanto family === The East Java Regional Police identified the victims of the fourth bombing as members of a terrorist group that were planning to execute additional terror attacks on churches. All of them are from the same family. The deceased family members are Anton Febryanto, the father and Puspita Sari, the mother. They involved their own children, Rita Aulia Rahman (aged 17) and Ainur Rahman (aged 15), Faizah Putri (aged 11), and Garida Huda Akbar (aged 10). The latter three survived.{{cite web|title=Sidoarjo Perketat Keamanan Usai Ledakan Bom Rusun Wonocolo Semalam|url=https://tirto.id/sidoarjo-perketat-keamanan-usai-ledakan-bom-rusun-wonocolo-semalam-cKnL |work=Tirto.id|accessdate=14 May 2018|last=Saputri|first=Maya|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} According to the police, the father was shot and killed by police officers. The explosion happened first. When the police reached the room, Anton threatened to push the trigger.{{cite web|title=Anton Dilumpuhkan karena Ancam Ledakkan Bom|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018911/anton-dilumpuhkan-karena-ancam-ledakkan-bom|work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|last=Rinanda |first= Hilda M.|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} Indonesian National Police revealed that Anton's family had close ties with Dita Uprianto, the leader of the Surabaya branch of the JAD. Anton also belonged to [[Jamaah Ansharut Tauhid]] (JAT, [[Tawhid]]'s [[Ansar (Islam)|Ansar]] Pilgrims). ===Tri Murtono family=== Authorities confirmed the identities of the Surabaya Police HQ attackers using the family certificate carried by the bombers.{{cite web|title=Polisi Temukan KK Pelaku Bom Polrestabes, Ini Identitasnya|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4020087/polisi-temukan-kk-pelaku-bom-polrestabes-ini-identitasnya|work=Detik.com|date=14 May 2018|last=Rinanda |first= Hilda M.|accessdate=15 May 2018}} They were all from the same family. The father was identified as Tri Murtono (aged 50), the mother was identified as Tri Ernawati (aged 43). They also involved their own two sons, Mohammad Dari Satri (aged 16) and Mohammad Dafa Amin (aged 14). The last one was only identified as Ais, an 8 year old girl who survived the blasts being saved by Rony Faisal.{{cite web|url=http://pekanbaru.tribunnews.com/2018/05/14/kisah-akbp-roni-faisal-saiful-faton-menggendong-ais-saya-langsung-angkat-anak-itu-saya-bopong|title=Kisah AKBP Roni Faisal Saiful Faton Menggendong Ais, 'Saya Langsung Angkat Anak Itu, Saya Bopong'|language=id|work=Tribunnews.com|editor=Budi Rahmat|date=14 May 2018|accessdate=15 May 2018}} She was seated in the front of her parents when the explosion happened.{{cite web|title=Tulisan di Celana Dalam Bocah Perempuan Selamat Ungkap Identitas Pelaku Bom Bunuh Diri |work=Tribunnews.com|editor=Fahrizal F. Daulay|url= http://medan.tribunnews.com/2018/05/14/tulisan-di-celana-dalam-bocah-perempuan-selamat-ungkap-identitas-pelaku-bom-bunuh-diri |date=14 May 2018|accessdate=15 May 2018}}{{cite web|title=Identitas Satu Keluarga Pelaku Bom Bunuh Diri di Mapolrestabes Surabaya|editor=Dewi Agustina|language=id |url=http://www.tribunnews.com/regional/2018/05/15/identitas-satu-keluarga-pelaku-bom-bunuh-diri-di-mapolrestabes-surabaya|work=Tribunnews.com|date=15 May 2018|accessdate=15 May 2018}} ===Child involvement=== The Indonesian National Police stated that it was the first time in Indonesian history that terrorists used their whole family including their own children to participate in a terror attack. Later reports revealed that some of the children actually had rejected their parents' offer to participate. One of the children, named as Ainur Rahman, the son of the Sidoarjo apartment complex bombing, stated that he constantly reject his parents' offer to join them in the terror attack. He stated that, at the time of the Wonocolo bombing, he didn't know that his parents were producing a bomb inside the house. His siblings also rejected their parents' doctrines.{{citeweb|title=Cerita Anak Bomber Surabaya Diajak Berjihad oleh Ayahnya|date=16 May 2018|accessdate=4 June 2018|url=https://www.viva.co.id/berita/nasional/1036752-cerita-anak-bomber-surabaya-diajak-berjihad-oleh-ayahnya|website=Viva.co.id|publisher=[[Visi Media Asia]]|lang=id}} Similarly, one of the children of the church bombers, identified as 16-year old Firman Halim, was seen crying approximately a day before the attack. A security officer stated that all four of the church bombers' children were crying at the musalla.{{citeweb|title=Tangisan Terakhir Anak-anak Bomber Surabaya Sebelum Serang Gereja|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4027980/tangisan-terakhir-anak-anak-bomber-surabaya-sebelum-serang-gereja |website=Detik.com|lang=id|date=19 May 2018|author=Audrey Santoso|accessdate=4 June 2018}} Authorities suspected that they cried because they knew that they were all going to blew themselves up in the next day and that they were reluctant to die.{{citeweb|title=Doktrin 'Ke Surga Bareng Keluarga' Hingga Anak Dita Menangis di Musala Sebelum Aksi Bom Bunuh Diri|url=http://bogor.tribunnews.com/2018/05/18/doktrin-ke-surga-bareng-keluarga-hingga-anak-dita-menangis-di-musala-sebelum-aksi-bom-bunuh-diri?page=all|lang=id|author=Yudhi Maulana Aditama|date=18 May 2018|work=Tribun Bogor|accessdate=4 June 2018}} ==Reactions== [[File:Bom Surabaya 2018.jpg|thumb|Indonesian President Joko Widodo (in white) visited one of the churches that were attacked by terrorists on 13 May]] ===Domestic=== The Communion of Churches in Indonesia (Persekutuan Gereja-gereja di Indonesia, PGI) and the [[Bishops' Conference of Indonesia]] (Konferensi Waligereja Indonesia, KWI) released statements expressing their condolences and requesting political elites to not utilize the incident for political gain.{{cite news|last=Ratnasari|first=Elise D.|title=PGI Imbau Bom Gereja Surabaya Tak Dipolitisasi|url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20180513125543-20-297766/pgi-imbau-bom-gereja-surabaya-tak-dipolitisasi|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=CNN Indonesia|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} The Indonesian Christian Students' Movement (Gerakan Mahasiswa Kristen Indonesia) called for President Widodo to evaluate the state's security apparatus.{{cite news|last=Damarjati|first=Danu|title=Marak Teror, GMKI Minta Jokowi Evaluasi Polri sampai BIN|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4018456/marak-teror-gmki-minta-jokowi-evaluasi-polri-sampai-bin|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} Multiple Muslim clerics, Indonesian political and public figures condemned the attack. [[Nahdlatul Ulama]] (NU) general chairman [[Said Aqil Siradj]] condemned the attack, remarking that "Islam condemns any form of violence. There is not a single religion in the world that justifies violence as a way of life." Nahdlatul Ulama also requested people to report on actions that may lead to radicalism or terrorism.{{cite news|title=Islamic groups condemn Surabaya church bombings|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2018/05/13/islamic-groups-condemn-surabaya-church-bombings.html|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=The Jakarta Post|date=13 May 2018|language=en}} [[Ansor Youth Movement]], a non-profit Islamic youth organization operating under the NU, strongly condemned the attacks as a vile, vicious attacks against humanity, especially in a place of worship. The organization general chairman Yaqut Cholil Qoumas urged law enforcement officers to tackle the threat of radicalization in social media.{{cite news|title=GP Ansor Kutuk Keras Aksi Terorisme di Tiga Gereja di Surabaya|url=http://www.tribunnews.com/nasional/2018/05/13/gp-ansor-kutuk-keras-aksi-terorisme-di-tiga-gereja-di-surabaya |date=13 May 2018|last=Triatmojo |first=Danang |work=Tribunnews.com|accessdate=13 May 2018|language=id}} The [[Indonesian Ulema Council]] denounced the attack, stating that the [[Quran]] clearly stated that the act of murdering innocents is a serious sin. They later urged the government to tackle Islamic radicalism in Indonesia to prevent such terror attacks.{{cite news|title=MUI: Alquran tak Ajarkan Melakukan Bom Bunuh Diri |url=http://www.republika.co.id/berita/dunia-islam/islam-nusantara/18/05/13/p8nfqh414-mui-alquran-tak-ajarkan-melakukan-bom-bunuh-diri|first=Rahmat|last=Fajar|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Republika.co.id|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} Muhammadiyah condemned the attacks, adding that suicide bombings and killing of innocent people is not jihad. The Surabaya branch of Muhammadiyah dispatched personnel to help the treatment of the victims.{{cite news|last=Agustina|first=Widiarsi|title=Muhammadiyah Kecam Teror Bom di Gereja Surabaya|url=https://nasional.tempo.co/read/1088310/muhammadiyah-kecam-teror-bom-di-gereja-surabaya|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Tempo.co|date=13 May 2018|language=ID}} President Widodo flew to Surabaya, visiting the bombed churches and the hospitalized victims. Condemning the attacks as "barbaric acts", he strongly condemned the perpetrators particularly for their use of under-aged children as suicide bombers.{{cite news|last=Prasetia|first=Andhika|title=Jokowi: Teror Bom Surabaya Biadab, Pelaku Gunakan 2 Anak|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4018471/jokowi-teror-bom-surabaya-biadab-pelaku-gunakan-2-anak|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} Expressing condolences for the victims, he stated that the bombings were "a crime against humanity, unrelated with any religion", adding that he had ordered police chief [[Tito Karnavian]] to "unravel the bombers' network to its roots".{{cite news|last=Prasetia|first=Andhika|title=3 Gereja Surabaya Dibom, Jokowi: Bongkar Teroris Sampai ke Akar!|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018475/3-gereja-surabaya-dibom-jokowi-bongkar-teroris-sampai-ke-akar|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} He guaranteed that the government will cover the medical expenses of all the victims.{{cite news|last=Agus|first=Feri|title=Jokowi Jamin Negara Biayai Korban Luka Bom Surabaya|url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20180513153814-12-297821/jokowi-jamin-negara-biayai-korban-luka-bom-surabaya|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=CNN Indonesia|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} He also stated that he will issue Government regulation in lieu of law (Perpu) if the lawmakers are unable to finalize the revision of anti-terrorism laws by June 2018.{{cite news|last=Sani|first=Ahmad F.I.|title=Jokowi Akan Keluarkan Perpu Jika RUU Terorisme Tak Juga Disahkan|url=https://nasional.tempo.co/read/1088628/jokowi-akan-keluarkan-perpu-jika-ruu-terorisme-tak-juga-disahkan|accessdate=14 May 2018|work=Tempo|date=14 May 2018|language=id}} The [[Ministry of Health (Indonesia)|Indonesian Ministry of Health]] confirmed President's statement that all hospital bills of the victims of the attacks will be paid by the government.{{cite news|last1=Sulistyawati|first1=Rr. Laeny|title=Menkes: Korban Bom Surabaya Ditanggung Pemerintah |url=http://www.republika.co.id/berita/nasional/umum/18/05/13/p8ns44414-menkes-korban-bom-surabaya-ditanggung-pemerintah|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Republika.co.id|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} Former [[Indonesian National Armed Forces]] commander [[Gatot Nurmantyo]] also denounced the attacks, stating that the perpetrators were trying to stain the image of Islam.{{cite news|title=Gatot Nurmantyo: Biadab! Bom Gereja Tujuannya Pecah Belah Islam|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018380/gatot-nurmantyo-biadab-bom-gereja-tujuannya-pecah-belah-islam|work=Detik.com|last=Irawan|first=Dani|accessdate=13 May 2018|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} One of the most controversial religious figures in Indonesia, [[Bachtiar Nasir]], a prominent member of the GNPF who had pushed for the imprisonment of the Christian–Chinese [[Governor of Jakarta]] [[Basuki Tjahaja Purnama]], also condemned the attacks. He stated that Allah will condemn and punish them severely and offered his condolences to the victims of the attacks.{{cite news|last=Damarjati |first=Danu|title= Bachtiar Nasir: Pembom Gereja di Surabaya Akan Dikutuk Allah|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018376/bachtiar-nasir-pembom-gereja-di-surabaya-akan-dikutuk-allah|work=Detik.com|accessdate=13 May 2018|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} Political figures blamed Islamic radicalism as the cause of the attacks. The Indonesian House of Representatives stated that the government needs to do a "jihad" against terrorism. Masinton Pasaribu, a representative from the [[Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle]] (PDI–P), stated that the attacks were an inhuman action and an extraordinary crime and the perpetrators should be severely punished.{{cite news|title=Politisi Ramai-ramai Kutuk Teror Ledakan Bom di 3 Gereja Surabaya|last1=Ibrahim|first1=Gibran M.|last2=Maharani|first2=Tsarina |last3=Hariyanto |first3=Ibnu |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4018339/politisi-ramai-ramai-kutuk-teror-ledakan-bom-di-3-gereja-surabaya|work=Detik.com|accessdate=13 May 2018|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} The [[Prosperous Justice Party]] (PKS), an Indonesian Islamic party, also condemned the attack and regarded the attack as highly anarchist. Party president Sohibul Iman, stated that all terror attacks are highly despicable, especially in places of worship. Spokesman from [[Golkar]], the second largest party in Indonesia, stated that the attacks were nothing but a cowardice act from several irresponsible people who stained their own religion. Prominent opposition party figure [[Fadli Zon]] also commented on the attacks. However, despite this, he was jeered and heavily criticized by the public as his criticism was viewed by many as an attack to the sitting President.{{cite news|last=Noor|first=Achmad R. |title=Cuitan Heboh Fadli Zon: Pemimpin Lemah, Teroris Berkembang|url=https://inet.detik.com/cyberlife/d-4018260/cuitan-heboh-fadli-zon-pemimpin-lemah-teroris-berkembang|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} Politicians from his party, [[Great Indonesia Movement Party|Gerindra]], joined the condemnation, without attacking the government. Gerindra chairman [[Prabowo Subianto]] expressed condolences for the attacks, asking the Indonesian people to maintain unity.{{cite news|last1=Ibrahim|first1=Gibran M. |title=Prabowo Kutuk Keras Teror Bom Gereja di Surabaya|work=Detik.com|language=id |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4018428/prabowo-kutuk-keras-teror-bom-gereja-di-surabaya|accessdate=13 May 2018|date=13 May 2018}} While campaigning for the [[Central Java gubernatorial election, 2018|Central Java gubernatorial election]] in [[Banyumas]], he instructed Gerindra cadres to protect places of worship.{{cite news|last1=Himawan|first1=Aditya|last2=Rosmala|first2=Dian|title=Teror Bom, Prabowo Instruksikan Anak Buahnya Jaga Rumah Ibadah |url=https://www.suara.com/news/2018/05/15/191034/teror-bom-prabowo-instruksikan-anak-buahnya-jaga-rumah-ibadah|accessdate=15 May 2018 |work=Suara.com|date=15 May 2018|language=id}} Spokesman from Indonesia's [[Democratic Party (Indonesia)|Democratic Party]], Didi Iriawan, shared the same message. He stated that the attack was unacceptable and called for severe punishment to the perpetrators. [[File:Tri Rismaharini Kunjungi Rumah Duka.jpg|thumb|Surabaya Mayor [[Tri Rismaharini]] visited the relatives of the victims of the attacks on 14 May]] Several vigils were held across Indonesia. Approximately 1,000 people participated in a vigil in Tugu Pahlawan in Surabaya where participants lit candles for the victims of the attacks. Vigils were also held in Bandung, Blitar, and Solo.{{cite web|title=Potret Aksi Solidaritas untuk Korban Bom Gereja Surabaya|url=https://news.detik.com/foto-news/d-4018787/potret-aksi-solidaritas-untuk-korban-bom-gereja-surabaya/3#share_top|work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018}} There was a free distribution of prosthetic from volunteer groups for the survivors of the attacks.{{cite web|title=Warganet Ini Tawarkan Prostesis Gratis untuk Korban Bom Surabaya|url=https://health.detik.com/berita-detikhealth/4018575/warganet-ini-tawarkan-prostesis-gratis-untuk-korban-bom-surabaya|work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|date=13 May 2018|last=Anwar|first=Firdaus}} ===International=== The [[Federal government of the United States|U.S. government]] condemned the attacks and later urged Americans to be aware of the security conditions in Indonesia,{{cite news|last=Farhan|first=Afif|title=AS Minta Warganya Berhati-hati Terkait Bom di Surabaya|url=https://travel.detik.com/travel-news/d-4018499/as-minta-warganya-berhati-hati-terkait-bom-di-surabaya|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id}} stating that they were ready to assist the Indonesian government in investigating the attacks.{{cite news|last1=Suherdjoko|title=US ready to help investigation into Surabaya bomb attacks: Envoy|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2018/05/16/us-ready-to-help-investigation-into-surabaya-bomb-attacks-envoy.html|accessdate=17 May 2018|work=The Jakarta Post|date=16 May 2018}} The [[Government of the United Kingdom|U.K. government]] issued a travel advice for British nationals who were planning to visit Indonesia in response to the bombings.{{cite news|last=Godfrey|first=Kara|title=Is Indonesia safe for travel: Latest travel advice following deadly church bombings |url=https://www.express.co.uk/travel/articles/958978/indonesia-church-terror-bomb-explosions-surabaya-city-travel-advice|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=The Daily Express|date=13 May 2018|language=en}} Australia issued similar travel advice for Australians in Indonesia.{{cite web|last=Prakoso|first=Johanes R.|title=Terkait Bom Surabaya, Australia Juga Keluarkan Travel Advice|url=https://travel.detik.com/travel-news/d-4018793/terkait-bom-surabaya-australia-juga-keluarkan-travel-advice|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id |accessdate=14 May 2018}} The [[Government of Hong Kong]] issued similar travel advice, stating that "Residents intending to visit the country or are already there should monitor the situation, exercise caution, attend to personal safety and avoid protests and large gatherings of people."{{cite web|last=Farhan|first=Afif|title=Akibat Bom Surabaya, Hong Kong Imbau Turisnya Hati-hati di Indonesia|url=https://travel.detik.com/travel-news/d-4018825/akibat-bom-surabaya-hong-kong-imbau-turisnya-hati-hati-di-indonesia|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id|accessdate=14 May 2018}} The [[Government of Ireland|Irish]], [[Government of Canada|Canadian]], [[Government of France|French]], [[Government of Malaysia|Malaysian]], [[Government of Poland|Polish]], [[Government of Singapore|Singaporean]], [[Government of the Philippines|Filipino]] and [[Government of China|Chinese]] governments also issued travel advice for their citizens.{{cite web|last=Farhan|first=Afif|title=Kemenpar Hargai Negara yang Keluarkan Travel Advice ke Indonesia|url=https://travel.detik.com/travel-news/d-4019859/kemenpar-hargai-negara-yang-keluarkan-travel-advice-ke-indonesia|work=Detik.com|accessdate=14 May 2018|language=id|date=14 May 2018}}{{cite news |last1=Natalia |first1=Ester Christine |title=Ini 12 Negara yang Rilis Travel Advice Menyusul Teror di RI |url=https://www.cnbcindonesia.com/news/20180516143728-4-15185/ini-12-negara-yang-rilis-travel-advice-menyusul-teror-di-ri |accessdate=16 July 2018 |work=CNBC Indonesia |date=16 May 2018 |language=id}} [[President of Singapore|Singaporean President]] [[Halimah Yacob]] and [[Prime Minister of Singapore|Prime Minister]] [[Lee Hsien Loong]] wrote condolences letters to Indonesia, stating that the Government of Singapore strongly condemned the attacks.{{cite web|title=Singapore leaders send condolences on bomb blasts in Indonesia|publisher=Mediacorp|url=https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/singapore-leaders-send-condolences-on-bomb-blasts-in-indonesia-10230566|work=Channel News Asia|accessdate=14 May 2018}} The [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Singapore)|Singaporean Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] later issued travel advice for Singaporeans in Indonesia.{{cite web|title=Terkait Bom Surabaya, Singapura Imbau Warganya di Indonesia|url=https://travel.detik.com/travel-news/d-4018995/terkait-bom-surabaya-singapura-imbau-warganya-di-indonesia|work=Detik.com|last=Prakoso|first=Johanes R.|accessdate=14 May 2018|language=id|date=14 May 2018}} [[Prime Minister of Australia|Australian Prime Minister]] [[Malcolm Turnbull]] condemned the attacks and offered condolences.{{cite web|title=Surabaya bombings: Turnbull condemns ‘brutality, inhumanity, blasphemy’|url=https://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/terror-threat-will-last-a-lifetime-dutton/news-story/13b14f8612c4f0f03af57778a9ac011c|work=The Australian|accessdate=14 May 2018|date=14 May 2018|first=Greg|last=Brown}} Similarly, the [[Government of Japan|Japanese government]]{{cite web|title=Jepang Mengutuk Serangan Bom di Gereja Surabaya |editor-last=Sekarwati|editor-first=Suci |url=https://dunia.tempo.co/read/1088643/jepang-mengutuk-serangan-bom-di-gereja-surabaya |work=Tempo.co|accessdate=14 May 2018|date=14 May 2018}} and the European Union offered their condolences and condemned the attacks.{{cite web|title=Statement on the attacks on Christian churches in Surabaya, Indonesia|work=European Union External Action|date=13 May 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018|url=https://eeas.europa.eu/headquarters/headquarters-homepage_en/44440/Statement%20on%20the%20attacks%20on%20Christian%20churches%20in%20Surabaya,%20Indonesia}} During a sermon at [[Saint Peter's Basilica]] in the [[Vatican City]], [[Pope Francis]] mentioned the attacks and requested prayers.{{cite news|last=Wells|first=Christopher|title=Pope prays for victims of Indonesia attacks|url=https://www.vaticannews.va/en/pope/news/2018-05/pope-francis-regina-coeli-13-may-2018-indonesia-attacks.html|accessdate=13 May 2018|work=VaticanNews.va|date=13 May 2018}} [[United Nations]] and [[Organization for Islamic Cooperation]] secretary-generals [[António Guterres]] and [[Yousef Al-Othaimeen]] both also released statements condemning the attacks.{{cite news|title=Leaders, luminaries condemn Surabaya bomb attacks |last=Septiari|first=Dian |url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2018/05/14/leaders-luminaries-condemn-surabaya-bomb-attacks.html|accessdate=14 May 2018|work=The Jakarta Post|date=14 May 2018|language=en}} Governments of [[Argentina]],{{cite news|title=Argentina condena ataques contra iglesias cristianas en Indonesia|url=https://mundo.sputniknews.com/politica/201805141078674465-buenos-aires-jakarta-condena-atentados/|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=sputniknews|date=15 May 2018|language=es}} [[Mexico]],{{cite news|title=Gobierno de México condena los ataques terroristas en Indonesia|url=https://noticieros.televisa.com/ultimas-noticias/mexico-condena-ataques-terroristas-indonesia/|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=Noticieros Televisa|date=13 May 2018|language=es-MX}} [[Panama]]{{cite news|title=Panamá condena atentados terroristas en Indonesia|url=http://www.panamaon.com/noticias/politica/44872-panama-condena-atentados-terroristas-en-indonesia.html|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=PanamaOn|date=14 May 2018|language=es-ES}} and [[Spain]] also decried the attacks.{{cite news|title=España condena atentados en Indonesia y ofrece apoyo en lucha antiterrorista|url=http://www.lavanguardia.com/politica/20180514/443581079018/espana-condena-atentados-en-indonesia-y-ofrece-apoyo-en-lucha-antiterrorista.html|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=La Vanguardia|date=14 May 2018|language=es}} ===Media=== Facebook immediately activated its [[Facebook Safety Check|safety check]] after the attacks.{{cite web|title=Facebook Aktifkan Safety Check Bom Surabaya, Begini Menggunakannya|author=Rachmatunnisa |url=https://inet.detik.com/cyberlife/d-4018987/facebook-aktifkan-safety-check-bom-surabaya-begini-menggunakannya|work=Detik.com|date=13 May 2018|language=id|accessdate=14 May 2018}} Social media was flooded with Indonesians who voiced their condolences, prayers, frustration, and anger in response to the attacks. The hashtags #PrayForSurabaya, #BersatuLawanTeroris (English: #UnitedAgainstTerrorists), and #KamiTidakTakut (English: #WeAreNotAfraid) immediately went viral on Twitter.{{cite web|title=Ledakan Bom di Gereja Surabaya, #KamiTidakTakut Jadi Trending Topic|last=Librianty|first=Andina|url=https://www.liputan6.com/tekno/read/3523420/ledakan-bom-di-gereja-surabaya-kamitidaktakut-jadi-trending-topic|date=13 May 2018|language=id|work=Liputan6.com|accessdate=14 May 2018}} In the aftermath of the attacks, hundreds of social media accounts were blocked by Google, Facebook and Twitter. Telegram also blocked 280 accounts.{{citeweb|title=Pascateror Bom, Ratusan Akun Diblokir Google, Facebook, Twitter|url=https://inet.detik.com/law-and-policy/d-4021864/pascateror-bom-ratusan-akun-diblokir-google-facebook-twitter?_ga=2.112367684.177957252.1526446395-2122087196.1514282302|publisher=''DetikINet.com''|accessdate=16 May 2018}} Indonesian National Police advised people not to share the graphic photos of the victims and the perpetrators of the attacks.{{cite web|title=Polisi Imbau Warga Tak Sebarkan Foto dan Video Korban Bom Gereja|url=https://regional.kompas.com/read/2018/05/13/11390671/polisi-imbau-warga-tak-sebarkan-foto-dan-video-korban-bom-gereja|work=Kompas.com|last=Faizal|first=Achmad|date=13 May 2018|language=id|accessdate=14 May 2018}} The Indonesian Broadcasting Commission (KPI) also advised news stations not to broadcast photos of dead bodies or other graphic materials on television. Several TV stations cancelled their TV programs in response to the bombings. This announcement was stated on air.{{cite web|title=Bom di Surabaya, KPI Imbau Media Tak Siarkan Gambar Korban |url=https://www.viva.co.id/berita/nasional/1035697-bom-di-surabaya-kpi-imbau-media-tak-siarkan-gambar-korban|date=13 May 2018 |language=id|work=VIVA.co.id|accessdate=14 May 2018}} ===Conspiracies and hoaxes=== In the wake of the attacks, many people began to accuse the police and the government that the attack was a false flag, which resulted in numerous accounts being reported to the police. A woman was arrested on 14 May 2018 in [[Sukadana]], [[West Kalimantan]] for her viral Facebook post accusing the government of having conducted the bombings as a [[false flag]].{{cite news|title=Sebut Bom Surabaya Rekayasa, Akun Facebook Seorang Oknum Kepala Sekolah Dicekal Polisi|url=http://jogja.tribunnews.com/2018/05/14/sebut-bom-surabaya-rekayasa-akun-facebook-seorang-oknum-kepala-sekolah-dicekal-polisi|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=Tribunnews.com|date=14 May 2018|language=id}} She was a state junior high school (Sekolah Menengah Pertama Negeri, SMPN) headmaster.{{cite news|last=Santoso|first=Audrey|title=Wanita yang Sebar Hoax Bom Surabaya Adalah Kepala Sekolah|work=Detik.com|url=https://detik.com/news/berita/4020242/polisi-tangkap-netizen-yang-tuduh-bom-surabaya-pengalihan-isu|accessdate=15 May 2018|date=14 May 2018|language=id}}{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} On the same day, a representative of a group named 212 Guard (Garda 212) also said that the bombings were false flag made to suppress those who were against the sitting government and demanding new president. The group itself was notorious for pushing the imprisonment of the Christian–Chinese [[Governor of Jakarta]] [[Basuki Tjahaja Purnama]], hence their namesake which refers to the [[December 2016 Jakarta protests]].{{cite web|title=Garda 212: Isu Aksi Teroris Pengalihan Isu 2019 Ganti Presiden|date=14 May 2018|work=Suara.com|accessdate=15 May 2018 |url=https://www.suara.com/news/2018/05/14/182141/garda-212-isu-aksi-teroris-pengalihan-isu-2019-ganti-presiden |last1=Gunadha|first1=Reza|first2=Dian |last2=Rosmala|language=id}} He also said that the terrorists were innocent and should not be blamed for the bombings.{{cite web|title=Garda 212: Bom Surabaya Pengalihan Isu, Jangan Salahkan Teroris|date=15 May 2018|language=id|work=Suara.com |accessdate=15 May 2018|last1=Gunadha |first1=Reza |url=https://www.suara.com/news/2018/05/14/182141/garda-212-isu-aksi-teroris-pengalihan-isu-2019-ganti-presiden|first2=Dian|last2=Rosmala}} The next day, another civil servant was arrested in [[Lhokseumawe]], [[Aceh]] for hate speech related to the attacks.{{cite news|last=Yusman |first=Deni|title=Kepala Dinas di Lhokseumawe Ditangkap karena Ujaran Kebencian|accessdate=16 May 2018|date=15 May 2018 |language=id |url=http://www.rri.co.id/lhokseumawe/post/berita/528321/sigap_polres/plt_kadis_dpmg_lhokseumawe_ditahan_karena_dugaan_ujaran_kebencian_di_facebook.html|work=[[Radio Republik Indonesia|RRI]].co.id}} On 20 May 2018, a lecturer working at the [[University of North Sumatra]] was arrested for saying the same as the aforementioned headmaster.{{cite news|last=Resi|first=Erlangga|title=Dipamerkan Polisi, Dosen USU 'Bom Surabaya Pengalihan Isu' Pingsan |work=Detik.com |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4029741/dipamerkan-polisi-dosen-usu-bom-surabaya-pengalihan-isu-pingsan|accessdate=22 May 2018|date=20 May 2018 |language=id}} Many politicians, [[Mohammad Mahfud]] for instance, condemned those who supported the false flag theory, stating that those people are psychopathic and basically are no different than the terrorists.{{cite web|title=Kultwit Mahfud MD soal Terorisme yang Dianggap Rekayasa|last=Kurnia|first=Tommy|language=id |url=https://www.liputan6.com/tekno/read/3524721/kultwit-mahfud-md-soal-terorisme-yang-dianggap-rekayasa |work=Liputan6.com|accessdate=15 May 2018|date=15 May 2018}}{{cite news|title=Ruhut Sitompul: Mereka yang Mengatakan Teror Sebagai Pengalihan Isu Lebih Sangat Biadab|last=Naren|first=Dian |url=http://wow.tribunnews.com/2018/05/15/ruhut-sitompul-mereka-yang-mengatakan-teror-sebagai-pengalihan-isu-lebih-sangat-biadab?page=all|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=Tribunnews.com|date=14 May 2018|language=id}} Hoaxes of bombs being detonated in other locations also spread through the internet. A man was arrested in [[Duren Sawit]] subdistrict of Jakarta for creating a post on Facebook saying a church there was attacked as well. He claimed to have intended it as a prank.{{cite news|last=Hariyanto|first=Ibnu|title=Motif Penyebar Isu Hoax Bom di Duren Sawit: Iseng|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4021312/motif-penyebar-isu-hoax-bom-di-duren-sawit-iseng|accessdate=15 May 2018|work=Detik.com|date=15 May 2018|language=id}} ===Rise of Islamophobia=== In the immediate aftermath of the attacks, there were rise in [[Islamophobia]] in Indonesia, even among Muslims. These hate crimes, however, were specifically targeted to niqab wearing women and Muslim men with long beard.{{citeweb|title=Viral Video Aksi 'Peluk Saya' Hijaber Bercadar di Surabaya|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4029312/saat-wanita-bercadar-aksi-peluk-saya-untuk-hilangkan-islamofobia|work=Detik.com|lang=id|accessdate=4 June 2018}} Reports revealed that niqab wearing women were harassed, stared at and called terrorists. Police stated that these hate crimes couldn't be tolerated, later added that even one of the relatives of the victims of the attacks was a niqab wearing woman.{{citeweb|title=Menyusul serangan teror, pemakai cadar dan celana cingkrang menangkis kecurigaan|publisher=BBC |lang=id|url=http://www.bbc.com/indonesia/trensosial-44199590}}{{citeweb|title=Viral Video Aksi Peluk Saya Hijaber Bercadar Di Surabaya|url=https://news.detik.com/berita-jawa-timur/d-4032680/viral-video-aksi-peluk-saya-hijaber-bercadar-di-surabaya|work=Detik.com|lang=id |accessdate=4 June 2018}} Several social experiments to tackle Islamophobia were later conducted across Indonesia. In Jakarta, a community of niqabis held an act of solidarity to the victims of the attack.{{citeweb|title=Jangan Islamofobia Hanya Karena Wanita Bercadar!|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4029993/jangan-islamofobia-hanya-karena-wanita-bercadar|work=Detik.com|lang=id|accessdate=4 June 2018}} They later voiced their support to the police to tackle terrorism.{{citeweb|title=3 Wanita Bercadar Ikut Aksi Dukung Polri Berantas Terorisme di CFD|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/4029226/3-wanita-bercadar-ikut-aksi-dukung-polri-berantas-terorisme-di-cfd|work=Detik.com|lang=id|accessdate=4 June 2018}} ==Pekanbaru sword attack== On 16 May 2018, a group of men attacked the Riau Regional Police headquarters in [[Pekanbaru]], [[Riau]]. The attack started when an SUV rammed into the police station and struck people and vehicles, including two journalists from [[tvOne (Indonesia)|tvOne]] and [[MNCTV]]. Police said masked men carrying [[katana|katanas]] attacked and hacked several people in the station. All but one of the attackers were shot dead. One police officer was killed. Two police officers and two journalists were injured.{{cite web|title=2 Wartawan Korban Serangan di Mapolda Riau Dibawa ke RS Bhayangkara |author=M. Syukur|url= https://www.liputan6.com/news/read/3527355/2-wartawan-korban-serangan-di-mapolda-riau-dibawa-ke-rs-bhayangkara|work=Liputan6.com|accessdate=16 May 2018|date=16 May 2018|language=id}} In the immediate aftermath of the attack, the street where the police HQ located was closed for indefinite time. Bomb disposal unit was called to the area as "cables and stuffs" were found inside the SUV.{{cite web|editor=Amirullah|title=BREAKING NEWS - Mapolda Riau Diserang, Begini Kronologisnya|url=http://aceh.tribunnews.com/2018/05/16/breaking-news-mapolda-riau-diserang-begini-kronologisnya|work=Tribunnews.com|accessdate=16 May 2018|date=16 May 2018|language=id}} One of the attacker who escaped from the site was arrested by the police. The four died attackers were identified as Mursalim, Suwardi, Adi Sufiyan, and Daud.{{citeweb|title=Ini Identitas 4 Teroris Penyerang Mapolda Riau|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4023568/ini-identitas-4-teroris-penyerang-mapolda-riau|work=Detik.com|author=Audrey Santoso|date=16 May 2018|language=id|accessdate=17 May 2018}} All of them were residents of Dumai. Hours after the attack, raids were carried out across Dumai, which was located around {{convert|178|km}} north of the capital of Pekanbaru.{{citeweb|title=Polda Riau Diserang Teroris, Polisi Gerebek Lima Titik di Dumai|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-4023319/polda-riau-diserang-teroris-polisi-gerebek-lima-titik-di-dumai|work=Detik.com|date=16 May 2018|author=Chaidir Anwar Tanjung|language=id|accessdate=17 May 2018}} Airguns and "electronics" were recovered from the sites. They added that the attackers were members of the Islamic State of Indonesia, which affiliates with the Dumai branch of ISIL. Chief of the Indonesian National Police [[Tito Karnavian]] stated that there were indications that the attack in Pekanbaru were linked with the Surabaya attacks, later added that the Pekanbaru attack might have been funded by the Surabaya cell.{{citeweb|title=Teroris di Pekanbaru Diduga Miliki Jaringan dengan Surabaya|url=https://www.republika.co.id/berita/nasional/hukum/18/05/16/p8ttbp430-teroris-di-pekanbaru-diduga-miliki-jaringan-dengan-surabaya|date=16 May 2018|author=Sapto Andika Candra|work=Republika|language=id|accessdate=4 June 2018}} ==See also== * [[2018 Mako Brimob standoff]] ==Notes== {{notelist}} ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{Militant Islamism in Southeast Asia}} {{Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant}} {{portal bar|2010s|Indonesia|Terrorism}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Surabaya churches bombings}} [[Category:2018 in Indonesia]] [[Category:2018 murders in Asia]] [[Category:Crime in Indonesia]] [[Category:Islamic terrorism in Indonesia]] [[Category:Suicide bombings in Indonesia]] [[Category:Islamist attacks on churches]] [[Category:Persecution of Christians in Indonesia]] [[Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in 2018]] [[Category:Improvised explosive device bombings in Indonesia]] [[Category:Mass murder in 2018]] [[Category:Mass murder in Indonesia]] [[Category:Murder committed by minors]] [[Category:May 2018 crimes in Asia]] [[Category:Surabaya]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in Asia in 2018]] [[Category:Attacks on police stations]]
